title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for x-values

1 point is earned for the justification

g' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1;

g' changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.

Points of inflection for the graph of y = g(x) occur at x = 1 and x = 4.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for x-values

1 point is earned for the justification

g' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1;

g' changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.

Points of inflection for the graph of y = g(x) occur at x = 1 and x = 4.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for x-values

1 point is earned for the justification

g' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1;

g' changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.

Points of inflection for the graph of y = g(x) occur at x = 1 and x = 4.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for x-values

1 point is earned for the justification

g' changes from increasing to decreasing at x = 1;

g' changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.

Points of inflection for the graph of y = g(x) occur at x = 1 and x = 4.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if identifies x = 2 as a candidate

1 point is earned if considers endpoints

1 point is earned for maximum value and justification

The only sign change of g' from positive to negative in the interval is at x = 2.

g(−3)=5+ ∫ 2 −3 g ′ (x)dx=5+( − 3 2 ) +4= 15 2    g(2)=5    g(7)=5+ ∫ 2 7 g ′ (x)dx=5+( −4 )+ 1 2 = 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGNb GaaiikaiabgkHiTiaaiodacaGGPaGaeyypa0JaaGynaiabgUcaRmaa pedabaGabm4zayaafaGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaGaamizaiaadIhacq GH9aqpcaaI1aGaey4kaSYaaeWaaeaacqGHsisldaWcaaqaaiaaioda aeaacaaIYaaaaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqaaiabgkHiTi aaiodaa0Gaey4kIipakiabgUcaRiaaisdacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaa igdacaaI1aaabaGaaGOmaaaaaeaacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaWGNb GaaiikaiaaikdacaGGPaGaeyypa0JaaGynaaqaaiaabccacaqGGaGa aeiiaiaadEgacaGGOaGaaG4naiaacMcacqGH9aqpcaaI1aGaey4kaS Yaa8qmaeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcacaWGKbGaamiE aiabg2da9iaaiwdacqGHRaWkdaqadaqaaiabgkHiTiaaisdaaiaawI cacaGLPaaacqGHRaWkdaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIYaaaaiabg2da 9maalaaabaGaaG4maaqaaiaaikdaaaaaleaacaaIYaaabaGaaG4naa qdcqGHRiI8aaaaaa@73E5@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the difference quotient

1 point is earned for the answer

g(7)−g(−3) 7−(−3) = 3 2 − 15 2 10 =− 3 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D5D@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for average value of g'(x)

1 point is earned for answer "No" with reason

g ′ (7)− g ′ (−3) 7−(−3) = 1−(−4) 10 = 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaace WGNbGbauaacaGGOaGaaG4naiaacMcacqGHsislceWGNbGbauaacaGG OaGaeyOeI0IaaG4maiaacMcaaeaacaaI3aGaeyOeI0Iaaiikaiabgk HiTiaaiodacaGGPaaaaiabg2da9maalaaabaGaaGymaiabgkHiTiaa cIcacqGHsislcaaI0aGaaiykaaqaaiaaigdacaaIWaaaaiabg2da9m aalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaaaaa@4C75@

No, the MVT does not guarantee the existence of a value c with the stated properties because g' is not differentiable for at least one point in -3 < x < 7.
